p.s: In the following analysis I will show the stylistic devices and how the author uses them to spread a certain message.
In the present text the story is told from the perspective of a first personfirst-person narrator, in this case Starr.
The first personfirst-person narrator comes in very good specially for telling this kind of story.
Because of the first narrator Starr's situation inside her can be told very good because you can get a more detailed view of her feelings and her impressions.
You can also identify yourself more, when she is telling the story.

The flashbacks that were used in this text, told by a first personfirst-person narrator, are being used to show Starr's PTSD and that she is still very sensitive with the confrontation of the situation.
Every time Starr is getting one of her flashbacks she is going into a daze.
That shows, that Starr relives the situation inside her again.
To show this sensitivity the first personfirst-person narrator is suitable.
Starr's state of mind is in general presented very unstable.
That is hown in line 45-55 My - (l. 45) Don't be scared... speak (l. 46).
Starr needs help to solve her problems inside and get the Starr who fights for Khalil.
That is the Starr she truly wants to be.
Starr's voice is shown as a weapon (ll. 33+40).
You can interpret her voice as a weapon of justice.
With this weapon Starr fights against the weapons of discrimination, the real weapons of the police.
It also shows how great Starr's voice is because it is the voice of the witness who saw the real face of the police.
In conclusion you can say that the first personfirst-person narrator is very important to show Starr's feelings, her anger and her way of thinking.
The stylistic devices that were used are being usd to show Starr's superiority in front of the police and her side on the peaceful side of protesting.
